newsitem.title: CANADA: Pan American still negotiating Dukat deal.
newsitem.headline: Pan American still negotiating Dukat deal.

text.p: Canada's Pan American Silver Corp said on Friday it is continuing to negotiate a purchase agreement for a major stake in Russia's Dukat silver complex.
"We are in the middle of negotiating a purchase agreement with the Property Fund in Russia," Pan American spokesman Ross Beaty said in a telephone interview on Friday.

Beaty was reacting to a Russian report that the Vancouver-based company planned to back out of the project. Pan American won a tender for 49 percent of the ailing Dukat silver complex on April 3. The Canadian company had offered investment worth US$302.6 million.
"What we announced when we won the bid is that there were a number of conditions to the bid," Beaty said.
"We are negotiating the conditions now and also dealing with the difficulties of both the existing condition of the mine and the nature of the Russian privatization process," he said.
Dukat is based in the northeastern Magadan region and contains about two-thirds of Russia's unmined silver reserves.
